profileText: A Representative from South Carolina; born near Orangeburg, Orangeburg County, S.C., November 25, 1832; attended the common schools; was graduated from Emory College, Oxford, Ga., in 1855; studied law; was admitted to the bar in 1858 and commenced practice in South Carolina; served as an officer in the Confederate Army during the Civil War; resumed the practice of law in Orangeburg, S.C.; member of the State senate 1880-1890; elected by the general assembly judge of the first judicial circuit in 1889; delegate to the Democratic National Convention in 1884; elected as a Democrat to the Fifty-third Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of William H. Brawley and served from April 12, 1894, to March 3, 1895; was not a candidate for renomination in 1894; again engaged in the practice of law in Orangeburg until 1907, when he retired; died in Orangeburg, S.C., May 26, 1912; interment in the Episcopal Cemetery.

note.content: Elected to fill vacancy caused by resignation of William H. Brawley, and took his seat April 15, 1894.

researchRecord.name: 1863-1912, 3 items and 1 volume.
researchRecord.description: Includes a diary from January 15 through March 5, 1865 describing the federal assault on Fort Fisher, North Carolina where James Izlar was captured, his imprisonment at Fort Columbus, Governor's Island, NY, and his reaction to news on General Sherman's advance across South Carolina. The papers also contain a muster roll of the Edisto Rifle Company from May 1, 1863; a printed circular letter from Orangeburg, SC in 1877 to the Democratic Club regarding the nomination of Dr. A. S. Hydrick by the Republican Convention and soliciting support of a regular nominee of the Democratic Party.; and a typed copy of James Izlar's obituary, May 26, 1912.

researchRecord.name: In the Samuel Dibble Papers, 1866-1931, 497 items.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include James Ferdinand Izlar.
